cab.content: Military Secret. From Secretary of State to Viceroy, Army Department, 7th June 1917. 3467. Your secret telegram, Foreign Department, of the 6th instant.As I have already informed you, His Majesty's Government leave decision inyour hands. If operations arc necessary you are doubtless fully alive to badclimatic conditions at this season, which, with unseasoned troops, will bespecially serious. I rely on you to take every possible precaution of amedical and sanitary nature, and to see that force is amply equipped withmedical personnel and supplies.
